meanings.definition: Related to or characteristic of commerce or commercial activity.
meanings.sent1: The ultracommercial district was filled with bustling shops and busy markets.
meanings.sent2: The company's ultracommercial approach led to increased sales and revenue.
meanings.sent3: The ultracommercial jingle for the store made everyone in town hum along.
meanings.sent4: Her ultracommercial mindset turned every conversation into a potential business opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The neon lights of the ultracommercial area lit up the night sky with promises of shopping delights.

meanings.definition: Excessively commercial or focused on making a profit.
meanings.sent1: The film was criticized for its ultracommercial product placements throughout the scenes.
meanings.sent2: The ultracommercial nature of the event left little room for artistic expression.
meanings.sent3: His ultracommercial tactics in the negotiation made the other party roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The ultracommercial atmosphere of the mall made her feel like she was just a walking wallet.
meanings.sent5: The ultracommercial mindset of the corporation prioritized profit above all else, even ethics.
